Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in refusal of Transportation Security Clearance (TSC)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Refusal of TSC by Transport Canada
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant acknowledged incidents but failed to provide explanation; memory lapse not accepted as justification
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged insufficient information provided to applicant
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant was given sufficient detail and multiple opportunities to respond
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Transportation Security Clearance regulations under Transport Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires notice of allegations and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of information and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Principles of procedural fairness under administrative law
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Past associations and incidents reported by law enforcement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant did not deny allegations or request further details
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant's lack of recall undermined credibility
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide explanations or character references
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Security concerns due to past conduct

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in refusal of TSC
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Incidents including illegal gambling were reported by law enforcement
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of fairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant claimed memory lapse but did not deny or seek clarification
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires knowledge of allegations and right to respond
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency of information provided to applicant
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant had adequate notice and two opportunities to respond
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Law enforcement reports on illegal gambling and associations
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Did not deny incidents, cited inability to recall
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Law enforcement records, applicant’s written submissions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Past criminal associations and involvement in illegal gambling
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative review with procedural fairness obligations

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of a controlled substance for the purpose of trafficking
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in TSC refusal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Reliance on law enforcement reports regarding drug-related activities
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant could not recall details but did not deny events
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness mandates awareness of allegations and chance to respond
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency and clarity of information provided
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Information provided was sufficient; multiple response opportunities given
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Law enforcement intelligence on past criminal associations
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Failed to deny or clarify allegations
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Past association with criminal activities involving drugs
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative screening with right to respond
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Duty of procedural fairness in administrative decision-making

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in refusal of TSC
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Adverse information based on past associations with criminal activities
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove procedural unfairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant stated inability to recall but did not dispute facts
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires notice and opportunity to make representations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of disclosure by Transport Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of detailed information about allegations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Sufficient information provided; applicant failed to engage meaningfully
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Could not recall, did not deny or request more info
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Ms. Doan, airport employee seeking TSC
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Association with criminal activities related to drug production
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative screening with right to respond
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness in security clearance decisions

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in TSC refusal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Detailed letter outlining incidents and associations provided to applicant
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant admitted she could not recall but did not challenge allegations
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness includes right to know allegations and respond
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Clarity and sufficiency of communication from Transport Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Two opportunities to respond; no request for clarification made
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Law enforcement reports on associations with drug traffickers
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Did not deny, did not submit character references
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant employed at Vancouver International Airport
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Past association with known drug traffickers
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness in administrative security assessments
